section.name: Version numbering scheme
section.span: How are Hippo ECM versions numbered?
section.p:
The version numbering works as follows.
Example: Hippo CMS v7.1, r2.05.02
Version part Definition Occurancy
v7 Hippo CMS architecture number 7 Every several years
v7.1 The 7.1 release of Hippo CMS, architecture 7 Four times a year
v7.1, r2 Shipping with Hippo Repository version 2 Every several years
v7.1, r2.05 The 5th sprint iteration, preparing for release v7.1 Monthly
v7.1, r2.05.02 The 2nd Release Candidate, at the end of sprint 5,
which resulted in release v7.1 Several per month
In this example, the codebase that the internally used versionnumber (r2.05.02) refers to was tagged as the supported Hippo CMS release v7.1.

The reason that we have two distinct version numbers (v7.x and r2.x) is that the first one (v7) refers to the Hippo CMS release, and the second one (r2) to the Hippo Repository release. Since Hippo CMS 7 was build after (and wraps) Hippo Repository 2, the version numbering that is often referred to in developers documentation and conversations is Hippo Repository v2.xx.xx. This is also the basis of our Jira project name (HREPTWO), which refers to Hippo Repository 2.

Starting from December 19th, 2008, after the release of Hippo CMS v7.0, our leading version number is the Hippo CMS release number (v7.x). Since Hippo Repository is frequently used as a headless repository without a CMS user interface, the repository version number is still in use to indicate changes in the Hippo Repository codebase.
